intro: Canthium oblongum, commonly known as the African devil's backbone, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and opposite, ovate leaves. The plant produces small, white to yellowish flowers arranged in clusters, which are followed by elongated, spiny fruits. Its distinctive appearance and unique morphology make it a notable species in its native habitat. Canthium oblongum is often found in open woodlands and along riverbanks, where it thrives in well-drained soils.
